name: politico
text:
Want a quick rundown of the most important news of the moment? Listen to POLITICO Dispatch, an indispensable daily podcast that takes you inside our global newsroom. Subscribe now.
https://t.co/DPUpEFlsul https://t.co/jBsbr7qSB4

name: politico
text: A Senate committee is re-engaging former Obama administration officials as part of an investigation targeting Joe Biden’s son, demanding transcribed interviews and documents for the Republican-led probe https://t.co/djJoOqv9Ae

name: politico
text:
Some states this year may amend their constitutions to ban “slavery.” (Yes, really.) 

The 13th Amendment only abolished slavery “except as a punishment for crime.” So completely banning it would prohibit using prisoners for forced and unpaid labor
https://t.co/ZUQjXtvK0E

name: politico
text: The Federal Election Commission is losing its short-lived quorum after Caroline Hunter, a longtime Republican commissioner of the FEC and former chair of the agency, is resigning https://t.co/yYvTu4GUp0

name: politico
text: Austin Mayor Steve Adler on Friday panned Texas Gov. Greg Abbott’s order to pause the reopening of the state’s economy, arguing that additional mitigation measures need to be imposed to stamp out a spike in coronavirus cases https://t.co/kIJAaA6PtE

name: politico
text:
A federal judge ordered the release of children held with their parents in U.S. immigration jails due to the coronavirus pandemic

https://t.co/dooBDQddXD

name: politico
text: Rep. Steve Cohen is urging Democrats to consider impeaching Attorney General William Barr https://t.co/4mEBMdDXX7

name: politico
text:
Attorney General William Barr announced the creation of a task force to counter what he called “violent anti-government extremists” who have targeted public monuments

https://t.co/sOZT4x0UhI

name: politico
text:
A growing number of big-name companies are signing onto an ad boycott against Facebook that started days ago as a brushfire among a handful of socially conscious brands

https://t.co/uqkaJtiTTp
